name: places/ChIJff8sUFBZwokRl8yrQy6Dh48
formattedAddress: 285 W Broadway Suite 410, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 285 W Broadway Suite 410, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: This site makes you sign up, type in all of your data and information including photos of front and back of driver’s license etc. Only when you go to message another user or open a message are you prompted to then pay to actually be able to use the site. If a company charges for services being clear and upfront is the way to conduct business properly and honestly BEFORE prompting would-be users to create profiles and go through the entire process.

originalText.text:
Misleading and deceptive company with a bad service. I signed up for Roomster's "5 Day Trial" and unknowingly Roomster automatically enrolled me into its $24.95 monthly subscription. There was no obvious mention of the automatic enrollment into its monthly subscription. Upon noticing the monthly charge, I immediately deactivated my roomster account and kindly asked Roomster for a refund of the $24.95.

The customer service response was "All Roomster subscription charges were authorized by you at the time of purchase via PayPal and a receipt was sent to you with instructions how and when to cancel to avoid any additional charges." Roomster doesn't even acknowledge that it was a trial and says I authorized this subscription. Terrible deceptive bait and switch business practice.

Even worse, the roommate search service is awful. Despite putting in a request for specific area, Roomster sent me tons of messages from people way beyond my requested area. I paid $7.95 (5 day trial price) to get tons of irrelevant and unwanted text messages and email messages. Then I was immediately charged $24.95, without any notice or warning, at the end of the 5 day trial.

Do yourself a huge favor and don't use Roomster.  It has been a huge waste of time and money.

THE NEXT DAY IT SHOWS IT ACTIVTED, AND I HAVENT EVEN BEEN ON IT. THEY HAVE CONTINED TO TAKE $24.95 EACH MONTH, EVEN AFTER MULTIPLE EMAILS AND PROOF FROM MY BANK STATEMENTS.  THEY ARE A SCAM AND THIEFS

originalText.text:
I explored joining this service and found a plethora of fake listings cooked-up to entice users to sign up for paid subscriptions to enable the full functionality of being able to contact prospective housemates.

The tells were subtle, but if you looked closely, you would see things like palm trees outside of the window of a rental here in DC! We ain’t got no palm trees here in Washington, DC; it’s waaay too far north for that! Gimme a break and GTFOutta here with that!

This outfit is now mired down in an gang of legal doo-doo with the Federal Trade Commission and state attorneys general offices.  Do a google news search and you will see what this has escalated to.

originalText.text:
Trash app, was being charged even tho profile said I was on the free version and you’re really paying to see mass messages with no way prescreen messages before they get to you to know if it’s even worth while.

Example-paying to view a message that ends up saying something like female only
